column1: SEO URL is always generated for the brand.
column2: SEO URL is always generated for the brand.

column1: Allow Google to INDEX the Category Page with the Filter Applied
column2: Allow Google to INDEX the Category Page with the Filter Applied

column1: Allow Google to FOLLOW Links on the Category Page with the Filter Applied
column2: Allow Google to FOLLOW Links on the Category Page with the Filter Applied

column1: Enable SEO URL for the attribute in order to use URL Aliases
column2: Enable SEO URL for the attribute in order to use URL Aliases

column1: Using the same value for option separation and to replace special characters is outdated and may cause issues.
column2: Using the same value for option separation and to replace special characters is outdated and may cause issues.

column1: If there are complex options like:'red-white', there will be a problem with single 'red' and 'white' options.
column2: If there are complex options like:'red-white', there will be a problem with single 'red' and 'white' options.

column1: In some cases such options will not be parsed by SEO URL router.
column2: In some cases such options will not be parsed by SEO URL router.

column1: We strongly recommend not to use the same symbol for option separation and to replace special characters.
column2: We strongly recommend not to use the same symbol for option separation and to replace special characters.

column1: See more cases in the User Guide
column2: See more cases in the User Guide

column1: URL will look 'category/autumn.html' instead of 'category.html?season=114'. See per-attribute settings for fine-tuning.
column2: URL will look 'category/autumn.html' instead of 'category.html?season=114'. See per-attribute settings for fine-tuning.

column1: Add Suffix to the Brand Pages and All-products Pages
column2: Add Suffix to the Brand Pages and All-products Pages

column1: To configure the 'Category URL Suffix' setting please go to Configuration - Catalog - Catalog - Search Engine Optimization - Category URL Suffix. FYI on the category pages the suffix is added regardless of this setting.
column2: To configure the 'Category URL Suffix' setting please go to Configuration - Catalog - Catalog - Search Engine Optimization - Category URL Suffix. FYI on the category pages the suffix is added regardless of this setting.

column1: For example, if a customer selects 3 options for the attribute `color`, the URL will look like http://example.com/red-green-blue.html.
column2: For example, if a customer selects 3 options for the attribute `color`, the URL will look like http://example.com/red-green-blue.html.

column1: Allow the Module to Modify Robots Meta Tag
column2: Allow the Module to Modify Robots Meta Tag

column1: Use "No" for compatibility with other SEO extensions.
column2: Use "No" for compatibility with other SEO extensions.

column1: Noindex when Multiple Attribute Filters Applied
column2: Noindex when Multiple Attribute Filters Applied

column1: Automatically Add rel="nofollow" to Filter Links when Required
column2: Automatically Add rel="nofollow" to Filter Links when Required

column1: Please refer per-filter settings to make exclusions.
column2: Please refer per-filter settings to make exclusions.

column1: Set the structure of canonical urls for category pages. Need help with the setting? Please consult the user guide to configure properly.
column2: Set the structure of canonical urls for category pages. Need help with the setting? Please consult the user guide to configure properly.

column1: To get these settings working properly please make sure you have enabled the Canonical Meta Tag here Stores > Configuration > Catalog > Search Engine Optimizations.
column2: To get these settings working properly please make sure you have enabled the Canonical Meta Tag here Stores > Configuration > Catalog > Search Engine Optimizations.

column1: Use Prev/Next Tags for Improved Navigation Pages
column2: Use Prev/Next Tags for Improved Navigation Pages

column1: Set 'Yes' to use rel=“next” and rel=“prev” tags and point Google where the next or the previous pages are. Please click here to learn more details.
column2: Set 'Yes' to use rel=“next” and rel=“prev” tags and point Google where the next or the previous pages are. Please click here to learn more details.

column1: Add Page Number to Meta Title
column2: Add Page Number to Meta Title

column1: Adds the Page Number at the end of the Meta Title, e.g. 'Apparel | Page 5'
column2: Adds the Page Number at the end of the Meta Title, e.g. 'Apparel | Page 5'

column1: Add Page Number to Meta Description
column2: Add Page Number to Meta Description

column1: Adds the Page Number at the end of the Meta Description, e.g. 'Apparel Description | Page 5'
column2: Adds the Page Number at the end of the Meta Description, e.g. 'Apparel Description | Page 5'

column1: It helps Google to rank your store higher. See details here.
column2: It helps Google to rank your store higher. See details here.
